00029 namespace reviver {
00030 // \cond DPOINT
00031 /*
00032  Forward Declaration of the main Point Class Eucledian d-dimensional point. 
00033  The distance is L_2
00034 */
00035 template<typename NumType, unsigned D>
00036 class dpoint;

00040 // Origin of d-dimensional point
00042 template< typename NumType, unsigned D, unsigned I > struct origin
00043 {
00044    static inline void eval( dpoint<NumType,D>& p )
00045    {
00046           p[I] = 0.0;
00047       origin< NumType, D, I-1 >::eval( p );
00048    }
00049 };
00050 
00051 
00052 // Partial Template Specialization
00053 template <typename NumType, unsigned D> struct origin<NumType, D, 0>
00054 {
00055    static inline void eval( dpoint<NumType,D>& p )
00056    {
00057           p[0] = 0.0;
00058    }
00059 };
00060 
00061 
00063 // Squared Distance of d-dimensional point
00065 template< typename NumType, unsigned D, unsigned I > struct Distance
00066 {
00067    static inline double eval( const dpoint<NumType,D>& p, 
00068                               const dpoint<NumType,D>& q )
00069    {
00070      double sum = ( (double) p[I] - (double) q[I] );
00071      sum = sum * sum;
00072      return sum + Distance< NumType, D, I-1 >::eval( p,q );
00073    }
00074 };
00075 
00076 
00077 // Partial Template Specialization
00078 template <typename NumType, unsigned D> struct Distance<NumType, D, 0>
00079 {
00080    static inline double eval( const dpoint<NumType,D>& p, 
00081                                const dpoint<NumType,D>& q )
00082    {
00083      double sum = ((double) p[0] - (double) q[0]);
00084      return sum * sum;
00085    }
00086 };
00087 
00089 // Dot Product of two d-dimensional points
00091 template< typename NumType, unsigned D, unsigned I > struct DotProd
00092 {
00093    static inline NumType eval( const dpoint<NumType,D>& p, 
00094                                const dpoint<NumType,D>& q )
00095    {
00096           NumType sum = ( p[I] * q[I] );
00097           return sum + DotProd< NumType, D, I-1 >::eval( p,q );
00098    }
00099 };
00100 
00101 
00102 // Partial Template Specialization
00103 template <typename NumType, unsigned D> struct DotProd<NumType, D, 0>
00104 {
00105    static inline NumType eval( const dpoint<NumType,D>& p, 
00106                                const dpoint<NumType,D>& q )
00107    {
00108           return (p[0] * q[0]);
00109    }
00110 };
00111

00114 // Equality of two d-dimensional points
00116 template< typename NumType, unsigned D, unsigned I > struct IsEqual
00117 {
00118    static inline bool eval( const dpoint<NumType,D>& p, 
00119                             const dpoint<NumType,D>& q )
00120    {
00121           if( p[I]  != q[I] ) return false;
00122           else return IsEqual< NumType, D, I-1 >::eval( p,q );
00123    }
00124 };
00125 
00126 
00127 // Partial Template Specialization
00128 template <typename NumType, unsigned D> struct IsEqual<NumType, D, 0>
00129 {
00130    static inline NumType eval( const dpoint<NumType,D>& p, 
00131                                const dpoint<NumType,D>& q )
00132    {
00133      return (p[0] == q[0])?(NumType)1:(NumType)0;
00134    }
00135 };
00136

00139 // Equate two d-dimensional points
00141 template< typename NumType, unsigned D, unsigned I > struct Equate
00142 {
00143    static inline void eval( dpoint<NumType,D>& p,
00144                             const dpoint<NumType,D>& q )
00145    {
00146           p[I]  = q[I];
00147           Equate< NumType, D, I-1 >::eval( p,q );
00148    }
00149 };
00150 
00151 
00152 // Partial Template Specialization
00153 template <typename NumType, unsigned D> struct Equate<NumType, D, 0>
00154 {
00155    static inline void eval( dpoint<NumType,D>& p,
00156                             const dpoint<NumType,D>& q )
00157    {
00158            p[0] = q[0];
00159    }
00160 };

00165 // Add two d-dimensional points
00167 template< typename NumType, unsigned D, unsigned I > struct Add
00168 {
00169    static inline void eval( dpoint<NumType,D>& result, 
00170                             const dpoint<NumType,D>& p, 
00171                             const dpoint<NumType,D>& q )
00172    {
00173           result[I] = p[I]  + q[I];
00174           Add< NumType, D, I-1 >::eval( result,p,q );
00175    }
00176 };
00177 
00178 
00179 // Partial Template Specialization
00180 template <typename NumType, unsigned D> struct Add<NumType, D, 0>
00181 {
00182    static inline void eval( dpoint<NumType,D>& result, 
00183                             const dpoint<NumType,D>& p, 
00184                             const dpoint<NumType,D>& q )
00185    {
00186            result[0] = p[0] + q[0];
00187    }
00188 };

00192 // Subtract two d-dimensional points
00194 // Could actually be done using scalar multiplication
00195 // and addition
00196 template< typename NumType, unsigned D, unsigned I > struct Subtract
00197 {
00198    static inline void eval( dpoint<NumType,D>& result, 
00199                             const dpoint<NumType,D>& p, 
00200                             const dpoint<NumType,D>& q )
00201    {
00202           result[I] = p[I]  - q[I];
00203           Subtract< NumType, D, I-1 >::eval( result,p,q );
00204    }
00205 };
00206 
00207 
00208 // Partial Template Specialization
00209 template <typename NumType, unsigned D> struct Subtract<NumType, D, 0>
00210 {
00211    static inline void eval( dpoint<NumType,D>& result, 
00212                             const dpoint<NumType,D>& p, 
00213                             const dpoint<NumType,D>& q )
00214    {
00215            result[0] = p[0] - q[0];
00216    }
00217 };
00218 
00220 //  Mutiply scalar with d-dimensional point
00222 // Could actually be done using scalar multiplication
00223 // and addition
00224 template< typename NumType, unsigned D, unsigned I > struct Multiply
00225 {
00226    static inline void eval( dpoint<NumType,D>& result, 
00227                             const dpoint<NumType,D>& p, NumType k)
00228    {
00229           result[I] = p[I] * k;
00230           Multiply< NumType, D, I-1 >::eval( result,p,k );
00231    }
00232 };
00233 
00234 
00235 // Partial Template Specialization
00236 template <typename NumType, unsigned D> struct Multiply<NumType, D, 0>
00237 {
00238    static inline void eval( dpoint<NumType,D>& result, 
00239                             const dpoint<NumType,D>& p, NumType k )
00240    {
00241            result[0] = p[0] * k;
00242    }
00243 };

00245 // \endcond
00247 // Main d dimensional Point Class
00249 // NumType = Floating Point Type
00250 // D   = Dimension of Point
00254 template<typename NumType, unsigned D>
00255 class dpoint {
00256 
00257                 // Makes Swap operation fast
00258                 NumType  x[D];
00259 
00260 public:
00261   NumType* point_begin()
00262   {
00263     return x;
00264   }
00265   NumType* point_end()
00266   {
00267     return x+(sizeof(x)/sizeof(NumType));
00268   }
00269         // For access from outside
00271         typedef NumType   __NumType;
00273         static const unsigned int  __DIM =  D;
00274 
00276         inline void move2origin(){ origin<NumType, D, D-1>::eval(*this); };
00277 
00278         dpoint(){ 
00279                 Assert( (D >= 1), "Dimension < 1 not allowed" ); 
00280                 // move2origin(); 
00281         };
00282 
00283         // 1 D Point
00284         dpoint(NumType x0){ x[0] = x0; };
00285 
00286         // 2 D Point
00287         dpoint(NumType x0,NumType x1){ x[0] = x0;  x[1] = x1; };
00288 
00289         // 3 D Point
00290         dpoint(NumType x0,NumType x1,NumType x2){  
00291                x[0] = x0;  x[1] = x1; x[2] = x2; 
00292         };
00293 
00294         // Array Initialization
00295         dpoint(NumType ax[]){ for(int i =0; i < D; ++i) x[i] = ax[i]; };
00296 
00297         // Initialization from another point : Copy Constructor
00298         dpoint(const dpoint<NumType,D>& p){  
00299                 Equate<NumType,D,D-1>::eval((*this),p); 
00300         };
00301 
00302         // Destructor
00303         ~dpoint(){};
00304 
00306         inline int      dim() const { return D; };
00307 
00310         inline double  sqr_dist(const dpoint<NumType,D> q) const ;
00311 
00314         inline NumType  distance(const dpoint<NumType,D> q) const ;
00315 
00318         inline NumType  dotprod (const dpoint<NumType,D> q) const ;
00319         inline NumType  sqr_length(void)  const;
00322         inline void     normalize (void);
00323 
00325         inline NumType& operator[](int i);
00326 
00328         inline NumType  operator[](int i) const;
00329 
00331         inline dpoint&  operator= (const dpoint<NumType,D>& q);
00332 
00334         template<typename NT, unsigned __DIM>
00335         friend dpoint<NT,__DIM>   operator- (const dpoint<NT,__DIM>& p, 
00336                                              const dpoint<NT,__DIM>& q);
00337 
00339         template<typename NT, unsigned __DIM>
00340         friend dpoint<NT,__DIM>   operator+ (const dpoint<NT,__DIM>& p, 
00341                                              const dpoint<NT,__DIM>& q);
00342 
00344         template<typename NT, unsigned __DIM>
00345         friend bool   operator== (const dpoint<NT,__DIM>& p, 
00346                                   const dpoint<NT,__DIM>& q);
00347 
00349         template<typename NT, unsigned __DIM>
00350         friend bool   operator!= (const dpoint<NT,__DIM>& p, 
00351                                   const dpoint<NT,__DIM>& q);
00352

00355 //      inline operator valarray<NumType>() const;

00357         template<typename __NT,unsigned __DIM>
00358         friend void iswap(dpoint<__NT,__DIM>& p,dpoint<__NT,__DIM>& q);
00359 };
00360 
00361 template<typename NumType, unsigned D>
00362 void dpoint<NumType,D>::normalize (void){
00363         NumType len = sqrt(sqr_length());
00364         if (len > 0.00001)
00365         for(int i = 0; i < D; ++i){
00366                 x[i] /= len;
00367         }
00368 }

00388 template<typename NT, unsigned __DIM>
00389 dpoint<NT,__DIM>
00390 operator+ (const dpoint<NT,__DIM>& p, const dpoint<NT,__DIM>& q){
00391         dpoint<NT,__DIM> result;
00392         Add<NT,__DIM,__DIM-1>::eval(result,p,q);        
00393         return result;
00394 }

00396 template<typename NT, unsigned __DIM>
00397 dpoint<NT,__DIM>
00398 operator- (const dpoint<NT,__DIM>& p, const dpoint<NT,__DIM>& q){
00399         dpoint<NT,__DIM> result;
00400         Subtract<NT,__DIM,__DIM-1>::eval(result,p,q);   
00401         return result;
00402 }

00404 template<typename NT, unsigned __DIM>
00405 bool
00406 operator== (const dpoint<NT,__DIM>& p, const dpoint<NT,__DIM>& q){
00407         return IsEqual<NT,__DIM,__DIM-1>::eval(p,q);    
00408 }
00409 
00410 template<typename NT, unsigned __DIM>
00411 bool
00412 operator!= (const dpoint<NT,__DIM>& p, const dpoint<NT,__DIM>& q){
00413         return !(IsEqual<NT,__DIM,__DIM-1>::eval(p,q)); 
00414 }

00416 template<typename NT, unsigned __DIM>
00417 dpoint<NT,__DIM>
00418 operator* (const dpoint<NT,__DIM>& p, const NT k){
00419         dpoint<NT,__DIM> result;
00420         Multiply<NT,__DIM,__DIM-1>::eval(result,p,k);   
00421         return result;
00422 }
00423 
00424 template<typename NT, unsigned __DIM>
00425 dpoint<NT,__DIM>
00426 operator/ (const dpoint<NT,__DIM>& p, const NT k){
00427         Assert( (k != 0), "Hell division by zero man...\n");
00428         dpoint<NT,__DIM> result;
00429         Multiply<NT,__DIM,__DIM-1>::eval(result,p,((double)1.0)/k);     
00430         return result;
00431 }

00433 template < typename NumType, unsigned D >
00434 dpoint<NumType,D>&
00435 dpoint<NumType,D>::operator=(const dpoint<NumType,D> &q)
00436 {
00437   Assert((this != &q), "Error p = p");
00438   Equate<NumType,D,D-1>::eval(*this,q); 
00439   return *this;
00440 }

00453 template<typename NumType, unsigned D>
00454 double
00455 dpoint<NumType,D>::sqr_dist (const dpoint<NumType,D> q) const {
00456         return Distance<NumType,D,D-1>::eval(*this,q);  
00457 }

00459 template<typename NumType, unsigned D>
00460 NumType 
00461 dpoint<NumType,D>::distance (const dpoint<NumType,D> q) const {
00462         return sqrt(
00463                 static_cast<double>(Distance<NumType,D,D-1>::eval(*this,q))
00464         );      
00465 }

00469 NumType 
00470 dpoint<NumType,D>::dotprod (const dpoint<NumType,D> q) const {
00471         return DotProd<NumType,D,D-1>::eval(*this,q);   
00472 }

00474 template<typename NumType, unsigned D>
00475 NumType 
00476 dpoint<NumType,D>::sqr_length (void) const {
00477         return DotProd<NumType,D,D-1>::eval(*this,*this);       
00478 }

00480 template < class NumType, unsigned D >
00481 std::ostream&
00482 operator<<(std::ostream& os,const dpoint<NumType,D> &p)
00483 {
00484      os << "Point (d=";
00485          os << D << ", (";
00486          for (int i=0; i<(int)D-1; ++i)
00487                 os << p[i] << ", ";
00488         return os << p[D-1] << "))";
00489     
00490 }
00491 
00492 template < class NumType, unsigned D >
00493 std::istream&
00494 operator>>(std::istream& is,dpoint<NumType,D> &p)
00495 {
00496          for (int i=0; i<D; ++i)
00497                  if(!(is >> p[i])){
00498                          if(!is.eof()){
00499                            std::cerr << "Error Reading Point:" 
00500                                      << is << std::endl;
00501                                 exit(1);
00502                          }
00503                  }
00504                  
00505         return is;
00506     
00507 }
